results.title: Fuse
results.creator_credit: Marcus Waters, Katherine Shortland, Maia Horniak and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A young Aboriginal girl wants to revenge the death of her older brother who has died while in jail for a petty crime. He was the only person she had in the world and now, desperately alone and angry, she finds the judge that sentenced her brother.
The film unfolds in the judge’s bachelor apartment where he is tied up and held captive as each of them confront their own judgements and their own pain.
An intense drama between two completely different people in one room over one night unfolds as they both behave in unexpected ways. Human emotions cross between the race, sex and class divide as each rediscover the meaning of loneliness, loss and judgement.
Cast: Shai Pittman, Chris Haywood

results.title: Fire of the Land
results.creator_credit: Valerie Bichard, Eliza Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
results.description: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.
description_for_label: Prior to the Sydney 2000 Olympics, ashes from a sacred aboriginal fire were taken to Victoria Park Sydney establishing the Aboriginal Tent Embassy, peace camp. Fire of the Land is the story of the Embassy’s campaign to get international recognition for Aboriginal sovereignty, capturing an unique moment in Aboriginal Protest history.

results.title: Figures in motion
results.creator_credit: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Eadweard Muybridge was the pioneer photographer whose experiments in stop-motion photography helped develop the technology that resulted in motion pictures. In this elegant fictional film, Muybridge forces his young wife to pose nude with his male lover. As the photographer begins to take his shots, he becomes more and more excited by the control he can exercise over both his lovers. An initially camp and light treatment of the erotics that forms the basis of voyeuristic desire in cinema, the film becomes progressively darker as Muybridge’s wife becomes the object of not only desire, but of appropriation and violence, signifying that even at the birth of cinema the male gaze was rapacious and pornographic.
Cast: Michael Percival, Lenore Munro, Anthony Cogin.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Glenn Weller, Priscilla Collins, Damien Power and AFTRS

results.title: Dressing dad
results.creator_credit: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Isabel Perez, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
If your dad wore a dress, would it make him less of a father, less of a man? A daughter’s journey to understand her father’s long-kept secret as a cross-dresser.
Cast: Alastair Barns (the dad), Lynne Vincent McCarthy as the daughter voice-over, and Leslie, Bianca, Kimberley, Steffie and Kim.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Lynne Vincent McCarthy, Isabel Perez, Sofya Gollan and AFTRS
results.description:

results.title: The Door
results.creator_credit: AFTRS, Anne Pratten, Jo-Anne McGowan and Josie Keys
results.brief_description: A bedroom door becomes the focus of a teenage girl’s battle with her insensitive stepfather to reclaim the simpler relationship she remembers sharing with her mother. Stars Barry Otto and Penne Hackforth-Jones. Original format 16mm.

results.title: Crouching at the door
results.creator_credit: Jason Camenzuli, Sean Croyston, Marzena Domaradzka and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Andy is constantly being compared unfavourably to his younger brother and the pressure has built up…This film looks at the dark, destructive nature of sibling rivalry and the unconscious cruelty of family expectations.
Cast: Mitchell McMahon, James Mashford, Alan Cinis, Karen Colston.

results.title: The Creepy Crawley's
results.creator_credit: Citt Williams, Beck Cole and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
The Creepy Crawleys, a documentary film, is set in an isolated Australian country town and tells the story of Monte Cristo, a mysterious old mansion and its owners, past and present.
Contains b&w archival stills.
results.description:

results.title: Blood brothers
results.creator_credit: Jessica Cribb, Rebecca Parker and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. They live in Willmot, an isolated community on the outskirts of Western Sydney. It’s a no-go zone, a suburban wasteland with huge powerlines overhead. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.
results.description: Paul and Ben are blood brothers. They’ve got heaps of brothers and sisters, but they’re the only ones with the same mum and dad. Paul and Ben struggle to survive poverty, “westie” stigma, violence and abuse. Each has their own way of keeping feelings of powerlessness and fear at bay but, ultimately, they have each other. Their story is about family, love, loyalty and what it truly means to be a blood brother.

results.title: Bias
results.creator_credit: Alice Addison, Steve Pasvolsky, Catriona McKenzie and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
Two old men are playing for the champion’s rosette in lawn bowls when a snail interupts play and causes one codger to win and the other to lose. The battle takes on a greater moral dimension…Animation and live action.
Cast: Lisle Jones, John Keightley

results.title: Bad Habits
results.creator_credit: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Jason Ramp and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rozlyn Clayton-Vincent, Justin Davies, Jason Ramp and AFTRS
results.description: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).
description_for_label: Bill has to make a compromise when forced to choose between his wife and his best mate. His best mate just so happens to be his dog Seven. Cast: Bill (Tommy Lewis), Hazel (Lillian Crombie, Seven (Duncan).
